name: Calories
description: Energy units that fuel your body's functions and activities. Calories come from macronutrients: carbohydrates, proteins, and fats.

name: Protein
description: Essential macronutrient made up of amino acids, crucial for building and repairing tissues, making enzymes and hormones.
benefits: Helps maintain healthy hair, skin, and nails
Provides satiety and helps control hunger

name: Carbohydrates
description: The body's primary source of energy, including sugars, starches, and fiber. Essential for brain function and physical activity.
benefits: Primary energy source for the brain

name: Fat
description: Essential macronutrient that provides energy, supports cell function, and helps absorb fat-soluble vitamins.
benefits: Helps absorb vitamins A, D, E, K

name: Fiber
description: Indigestible carbohydrate that supports digestive health, helps control blood sugar, and promotes satiety.

name: Sugar
description: Simple carbohydrates that provide quick energy. Natural sugars from fruits come with beneficial nutrients, while added sugars should be limited.

name: Sodium
description: Essential mineral that helps maintain fluid balance, supports nerve function, and muscle contractions. However, excess intake can raise blood pressure.

name: Vitamin C
description: Water-soluble antioxidant vitamin essential for immune function, collagen synthesis, and iron absorption.
benefits: Supports healthy skin and tissue repair

name: Vitamin D
description: Fat-soluble vitamin crucial for bone health, immune function, and calcium absorption. Often called the 'sunshine vitamin'.

name: Iron
description: Essential mineral crucial for oxygen transport in blood, energy production, and proper immune function.

name: Calcium
description: Essential mineral vital for bone and teeth health, muscle function, and nerve transmission.
